channel.title: Scripting News
channel.description: Scripting News, the weblog started in 1994 that bootstrapped the blogging revolution. üöÄ

item.description: Trump throws Rick Perry under the bus. What if Perry's popularity goes up as a result? Think about it.

source:outline.text: Trump throws Rick Perry under the bus. What if Perry's popularity goes up as a result? Think about it.

item.description: Why are we impeaching the president, big picture. Our system has gone off the rails, we've got a monarch in the White House. This impeachment is the second American Revolution and has the same goal as the first, to depose a king. And again, we have to change the rules so it won't happen again.

source:outline.text: Why are we impeaching the president, big picture. Our system has gone off the rails, we've got a monarch in the White House. This impeachment is the second American Revolution and has the same goal as the first, to depose a king. And again, we have to change the rules so it won't happen again.

item.description: An idea. If Trump refuses to leave the White House, change its name to Federal Penitentiary #248, place guards at all doors, no one goes in or out. No Internet access, no food. The constitutional president governs from Blair House. Trump comes out or dies there. Either way, eventually the White House is torn down, as a symbol of the imperial presidency. From now on the president strictly follows the Constitution, no more undeclared wars, Congress appropriates the money. Impeachment hearings start immediately after the Inauguration, and at the first sign of the breach of the Constitution, the president is impeached and removed. It's not going to be a glamorous job in the future. We're getting rid of our second king, and we must make sure no usurper like Trump can turn the office of President into an authoritarian pulpit. Burning the White House to the ground serves as a symbol of that transition.

source:outline.text: An idea. If Trump refuses to leave the White House, change its name to Federal Penitentiary #248, place guards at all doors, no one goes in or out. No Internet access, no food. The constitutional president governs from Blair House. Trump comes out or dies there. Either way, eventually the White House is torn down, as a symbol of the imperial presidency. From now on the president strictly follows the Constitution, no more undeclared wars, Congress appropriates the money. Impeachment hearings start immediately after the Inauguration, and at the first sign of the breach of the Constitution, the president is impeached and removed. It's not going to be a glamorous job in the future. We're getting rid of our second king, and we must make sure no usurper like Trump can turn the office of President into an authoritarian pulpit. Burning the White House to the ground serves as a symbol of that transition.

item.description: My mother taught me that when people resort to name-calling that means they're wrong and they know it.

source:outline.text: My mother taught me that when people resort to name-calling that means they're wrong and they know it.

item.description: More whistleblowers please. üôè

source:outline.text: More whistleblowers please. üôè

item.description: Trump isn‚Äôt playing multidimensional chess, and neither is Putin. His goal was to reduce the US to chaos. Our elections are now meaningless. Mass killings by people with automatic weapons. No sense of normalcy. The news people are focused on impeachment, but since just after the 2016 election have buried the big story. The US has been defeated. We're occupied. We live in Vichy America. The president is a Russian asset. It's all out in the open, but until the whistleblower, no one, not Mueller, not the Repubs in Congress, not the Dems in Congress, nor the Dems running for president, have had the guts to say the truth out loud. We all hope someone else will take the risk. We have to fight to get out of this. It's going to be bloody. But the longer we wait the worse it'll be.

source:outline.text: Trump isn‚Äôt playing multidimensional chess, and neither is Putin. His goal was to reduce the US to chaos. Our elections are now meaningless. Mass killings by people with automatic weapons. No sense of normalcy. The news people are focused on impeachment, but since just after the 2016 election have buried the big story. The US has been defeated. We're occupied. We live in Vichy America. The president is a Russian asset. It's all out in the open, but until the whistleblower, no one, not Mueller, not the Repubs in Congress, not the Dems in Congress, nor the Dems running for president, have had the guts to say the truth out loud. We all hope someone else will take the risk. We have to fight to get out of this. It's going to be bloody. But the longer we wait the worse it'll be.

item.description: This is the moment Trump should have been impeached. It was obvious at that point who Trump was/is.

source:outline.text: This is the moment Trump should have been impeached. It was obvious at that point who Trump was/is.

item.description: 2 years ago today: It's too easy for one person to shoot 600.

source:outline.text: 2 years ago today: It's too easy for one person to shoot 600.

item.description: RBG says historians will view today's political climate as an aberration. My two cents. This will be remembered as the time we all waited for someone else to take the risk, not wanting to disturb our lives. The spoiled citizens of a country that fought wars without a draft, that got tax cuts in time of war, inflated our economy as we inflicted chaos on others.

source:outline.text: RBG says historians will view today's political climate as an aberration. My two cents. This will be remembered as the time we all waited for someone else to take the risk, not wanting to disturb our lives. The spoiled citizens of a country that fought wars without a draft, that got tax cuts in time of war, inflated our economy as we inflicted chaos on others.

item.description: There should be a user interface standard for this object. There are minor differences in layout, but all have the same info.

source:outline.text: There should be a user interface standard for this object. There are minor differences in layout, but all have the same info.

item.description: Kamala Harris, presidential candidate, wants Twitter to suspend Donald Trump's Twitter account. My two cents. This is what‚Äôs wrong with today‚Äôs net, that it‚Äôs up to one unelected unaccountable tech exec to decide if the elected president has a voice. Twitter has too much power. They endow people they like with millions of followers, and delete accounts for friends. No one has to listen to Trump. I‚Äôve had him blocked for years.

They endow people they like with millions of followers, and delete accounts for friends. No one has to listen to Trump. I‚Äôve had him blocked for years.

item.description: There's no excuse for congresspeople to use Medium. Here's a press release from Speaker Pelosi. Look at the URL. It looks way better than anything on Medium, and it has the advantage that it will remain on the web even if Medium shuts down.

source:outline.text: There's no excuse for congresspeople to use Medium. Here's a press release from Speaker Pelosi. Look at the URL. It looks way better than anything on Medium, and it has the advantage that it will remain on the web even if Medium shuts down.

item.description: For people who get the nightly email, if you have a comment, just reply to the email. For now what you say is just between us. I'm thinking about ways to re-open the blog to interaction, but have it be as convenient as possible for the reader/contributors. I have powerful content management tools and I want to use them.

source:outline.text: For people who get the nightly email, if you have a comment, just reply to the email. For now what you say is just between us. I'm thinking about ways to re-open the blog to interaction, but have it be as convenient as possible for the reader/contributors. I have powerful content management tools and I want to use them.

item.title: Joe talk like a human being
item.description:
Joe you need to simplify your response.

"Trump you're a kook, a crook and a traitor to our country."

Try that out, it's easier for everyone to understand and it has the proper level of feeling to it. It's also achingly obvious.

You're in Mike Dukakis territory man.

source:outline.text: Joe talk like a human being
Joe you need to simplify your response.
"Trump you're a kook, a crook and a traitor to our country."
Try that out, it's easier for everyone to understand and it has the proper level of feeling to it. It's also achingly obvious.
You're in Mike Dukakis territory man.

item.title: Lists with a point
item.description:
I hate ageism.

  1. I was asked today if I still work or am I retired.
  2. It was a moment.
  3. I saw Joe Biden make a speech.
  4. Joe is not corrupt
  5. But Joe is too old to run.
  6. I'm sorry.

Hillary on Maddow last night.

  1. A half-hour.
  2. She said nothing.
  3. This is why she was a bad candidate.
  4. It's not authenticity.
  5. It's a failure to connect.
  6. Basic story-telling.
  7. Warren has it.
  8. Michael Moore has oodles of it.
  9. Hillary? Nada.

source:outline.text: Lists with a point
I hate ageism.

She said nothing.

It's not authenticity.
It's a failure to connect.
Basic story-telling.
Warren has it.
Michael Moore has oodles of it.
Hillary? Nada.

item.description: The reporting on Ukraine misses an important point. Not only was Trump putting the squeeze on Ukraine to become part of his mob, he was also selling them out. A small relatively powerless country that depended on our protection, Trump was stepping back and letting Russia roll over them.

source:outline.text: The reporting on Ukraine misses an important point. Not only was Trump putting the squeeze on Ukraine to become part of his mob, he was also selling them out. A small relatively powerless country that depended on our protection, Trump was stepping back and letting Russia roll over them.

item.description: Reporters should consider that Bernie Sanders might not want to continue his campaign.

source:outline.text: Reporters should consider that Bernie Sanders might not want to continue his campaign.

item.description: OMG you have to see this.

source:outline.text: OMG you have to see this.

item.description: I just had a vision of Trump's future.

source:outline.text: I just had a vision of Trump's future.

item.description: Michael Moore was a guest on MSNBC last night. It was really refreshing. He provides the perspective of a person. He thinks Biden should be leading the fight against Trump. I agreed with everything he said. Clear thinking. Totally worth watching.

source:outline.text: Michael Moore was a guest on MSNBC last night. It was really refreshing. He provides the perspective of a person. He thinks Biden should be leading the fight against Trump. I agreed with everything he said. Clear thinking. Totally worth watching.

item.description: Poll: If you're watching Succession, who's your favorite?

source:outline.text: Poll: If you're watching Succession, who's your favorite?

item.description: WIth Big 25 coming up, it's great to hear from people who were reading in the early years. For example, David Boroditsky checked in yesterday on Twitter. He sent a link to an email he sent me, which I posted to the blog, in Oct 1996, two years after the start. He talks about the non-web features of Frontier. Sometimes I forget that Frontier and the blog were two sides of the same coin in the early days. All the early blogging and RSS software ran in Frontier.

source:outline.text: WIth Big 25 coming up, it's great to hear from people who were reading in the early years. For example, David Boroditsky checked in yesterday on Twitter. He sent a link to an email he sent me, which I posted to the blog, in Oct 1996, two years after the start. He talks about the non-web features of Frontier. Sometimes I forget that Frontier and the blog were two sides of the same coin in the early days. All the early blogging and RSS software ran in Frontier.

item.description: Because Barr is in such a precarious position, and he's smart, he must have factored in the risk before going out on the limb. He's betting that he and Trump et al will be able to toss the Constitution in a trash can, and govern any way they want, without oversight and inconvenient co-equal branches of government. We're at much at risk as he is.

source:outline.text: Because Barr is in such a precarious position, and he's smart, he must have factored in the risk before going out on the limb. He's betting that he and Trump et al will be able to toss the Constitution in a trash can, and govern any way they want, without oversight and inconvenient co-equal branches of government. We're at much at risk as he is.

item.description: Trump is breaking the Constitution. Openly, and it'll never be repaired if he isn't cancelled. We should have fought this "civil war" a long time ago, but all the time we delay the chances of our form of govt surviving goes down.

source:outline.text: Trump is breaking the Constitution. Openly, and it'll never be repaired if he isn't cancelled. We should have fought this "civil war" a long time ago, but all the time we delay the chances of our form of govt surviving goes down.

item.description: 20-minute podcast about the origins of Scripting News. The original idea, 25 years ago, was letting go of product ideas that I wouldn't be able to commercialize. It, in turn, generated ideas that would define a huge industry. The big idea of blogging would turn out to be Sources Go Direct.

source:outline.text: 20-minute podcast about the origins of Scripting News. The original idea, 25 years ago, was letting go of product ideas that I wouldn't be able to commercialize. It, in turn, generated ideas that would define a huge industry. The big idea of blogging would turn out to be Sources Go Direct.

item.description: In less than a week my blog will be 25 years old. If it were a person it would be able to rent a car.

source:outline.text: In less than a week my blog will be 25 years old. If it were a person it would be able to rent a car.

item.description: In the almost-25 years of blogging on scripting.com, I did take a few weeks off here and there. In the 90s, mostly to take week-long massage classes, at places where there was no internet access, which was common back then, believe it or not.

source:outline.text: In the almost-25 years of blogging on scripting.com, I did take a few weeks off here and there. In the 90s, mostly to take week-long massage classes, at places where there was no internet access, which was common back then, believe it or not.

item.description: My two cents on changing Facebook to keep its power manageable. 1. Its social graph should be a public resource. Spin it out. The APIs should be open like the web APIs are. 2. Facebook should peer with the open web, so it isn't a silo.

source:outline.text: My two cents on changing Facebook to keep its power manageable. 1. Its social graph should be a public resource. Spin it out. The APIs should be open like the web APIs are. 2. Facebook should peer with the open web, so it isn't a silo.

item.description: 2017: You can fake caring but you can't fake showing up.

source:outline.text: 2017: You can fake caring but you can't fake showing up.

item.description: Why is it that the future-of-news conversation is exclusive to people who have a vested interest in the way things are. If we've learned anything about the future -- of everything -- is that it's disruptive to the way things are.

source:outline.text: Why is it that the future-of-news conversation is exclusive to people who have a vested interest in the way things are. If we've learned anything about the future -- of everything -- is that it's disruptive to the way things are.
